intro: Hyptis colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian hyptis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are usually violet or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Hyptis colombiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
